positive.review:
This is a simulator - It is a training aid for learning to fly radio controlled aircraft, and as such it is an invaluable tool.  I have seen people give this a bad review based on their expectations of playing a game, which this is not. (although it is a lot of fun to practice flying with).
My advice - if you want to learn how to fly R/C, this is a very good option (you will need additional hardware). 
If you want an aircraft type game look elsewhere.
it is fun because it is funny when you get one of those foam airplanes and go to alpine lake.
it is a good trainer. when you are doing challenges it makes you better at flying without thinking about it
Definitely get some simulator hours before flying! Its always nice to fly virtually before you do it in reality.

Stable and realistic RC simulator. I like it a lot. Great air fields.

Bigger variety of gliders would be nice. A filter to select electric powered gliders seems to be missing. Multiplex Funray would e.g. be a great addition. Or some sleek F5J models. Or even the fun of F3K planes (discus/hand launched gliders).

I really like this rc sim it has tuaght me to fly 3D rc style and not as expensive as areofly. I personally never played Areofly but i would love to play it, But this sim is great it does mostly everything you want just doesnt look that pretty.

Game is great, but the VR is seriously lack luster. It takes a huge performance hit to the system, rendering it pretty much unusable for other software simultaneously, while providing a pretty terrible VR experience. There is tearing, ghosting, and duplicating of objects when turning your head. Honestly pretty disappointing as someone who will be flying FPV as a job, and really needs practice while at home. Would love to see an up-to-date VR renderer that would actually work instead of the sad excuse of one they use now.
overall good missing a lot of content i would like .like indoor  flying and indoor planes

Pricey, but cheaper then wrecking a real plane.  I use it as a training aid with my flight controller, as a game this would be pretty underwhelming especially for the price.  It's nice that the developers add the real aircraft they come out with though and I've found a lot of enjoyment with it.

This Game is amazing. A little Expensive for what it is but its still good. I love how it includes Real RC Aircraft (E-Flight, UMX, ect) 
I would say 9.5/10
Great for learning to fly RC airplanes and helicopters.

I recommend this to anyone and everyone that wants to learn Remote Controlled planes / helicopters. I have been using this program (before it was on steam) for over 20 years. I cannot say how much money it has saved me by crashing in the sim instead of out on the field. 

You will want / need the controller InterLinkDx sim controller at least if you do not have one already. Once you feel confident in the sim check out AMA's site and find a local club that can help you with your first flight! Good luck and remember have fun!
good graphics. flying glider over ridge line  vert responsive  zoom  get speed  then pulled up. fast flying,

It has made myself and my son good flyers. Without it we would of crashed long ago. My son is now flying 3d and when we flies the real planes he flies 3d without any trouble.
All the planes fly exactly like the real planes.   Amazing !!!!!!

I have gone back to the simulator again because i am doing Airplanes instead of Heli"s this time. I have logged some decent hours on the RealFlight program. I had started to fly and kept crashing.  Now I can use a whole battery pack, from take off to landing. The scenarios are endless, airfield, terrain, wind, this program has it all.
The planes fly like they do in rl. Has boosted my flying skills greatly. Great respurce if your're into flying.
Good, fun, realistic
its very helpfull for begginers like I myself
Great for learning to fly RC and keeping the touch.
it helps you get better at flying before you actually fly in real life
great game using my Jeti DS-12
great learning tool!
love it teaching me to fly rc planes
I Like Plane.Me like To watch Planes.Me like to fly.
fun
it rekistic
i like it
Great trainer!
I love flying
Good trainer
GOTY
gg

This is a simulator - It is a training aid for learning to fly radio controlled aircraft, and as such it is an invaluable tool.  I have seen people give this a bad review based on their expectations of playing a game, which this is not. (although it is a lot of fun to practice flying with).
My advice - if you want to learn how to fly R/C, this is a very good option (you will need additional hardware). 
If you want an aircraft type game look elsewhere.
Great platform for understanding flight basics and crashing is free!
Great way to train, have fun and if you crash costs nothing to push the space bar and start over. Love it!
it is a good trainer. when you are doing challenges it makes you better at flying without thinking about it
it is fun because it is funny when you get one of those foam airplanes and go to alpine lake.

very fun! saves you from crashing real airplanes while having fun. I also got into fpv drones while trying the sim. I learned the basics, got a higher end sim (uncrashed) and now it is my biggest hobby
Great simulator! just need to figure out how to get the flaps to work with me DX6i transmitter and all will be right with the universe...
Great practice for the real thing and it builds on intuitive stick control.
Great for practice! However to fly or practice with any recently released planes you have to buy the DLC's and those can add up in price very quickly. Still really fun to play .

Great game very realistic. A must for r/c flyer to check new Eflite airplane and practice your maneuvers . You save thousands of dollar in buying  an airplane you won t like and in crashes and repair .
Just love it for helping with orientation of planes and learning the different transmitter functions in a safe environment.
Definitely get some simulator hours before flying! Its always nice to fly virtually before you do it in reality.

Stable and realistic RC simulator. I like it a lot. Great air fields.

Bigger variety of gliders would be nice. A filter to select electric powered gliders seems to be missing. Multiplex Funray would e.g. be a great addition. Or some sleek F5J models. Or even the fun of F3K planes (discus/hand launched gliders).

I really like this rc sim it has tuaght me to fly 3D rc style and not as expensive as areofly. I personally never played Areofly but i would love to play it, But this sim is great it does mostly everything you want just doesnt look that pretty.

Game is great, but the VR is seriously lack luster. It takes a huge performance hit to the system, rendering it pretty much unusable for other software simultaneously, while providing a pretty terrible VR experience. There is tearing, ghosting, and duplicating of objects when turning your head. Honestly pretty disappointing as someone who will be flying FPV as a job, and really needs practice while at home. Would love to see an up-to-date VR renderer that would actually work instead of the sad excuse of one they use now.
overall good missing a lot of content i would like .like indoor  flying and indoor planes

Pricey, but cheaper then wrecking a real plane.  I use it as a training aid with my flight controller, as a game this would be pretty underwhelming especially for the price.  It's nice that the developers add the real aircraft they come out with though and I've found a lot of enjoyment with it.

This Game is amazing. A little Expensive for what it is but its still good. I love how it includes Real RC Aircraft (E-Flight, UMX, ect) 
I would say 9.5/10
it's and good practice if you want to simulate flying an RC plane, or practice before buying one

It's a great simulator and one where flying can be actually enjoyable.There's plenty to do and learn so this will actually help you fly. Obviously nothing beats actually flying but still. Only big issue is the fact that half the time I try to play it it comes up with an error about a controller which just goes away by itself eventually. I don't know why or how to fix it indefinatelly but all I know is that the error makes me hate trying to play this game.
Awesome game. Having a lot of fun practicing flying my model plane.
Great sim for both planes and Heli's. Physics feel realistic, tons of models to try, and it’s saving me money (and crashes) at the field. Worth it if you fly RC

The installation was easy and everything worked perfectly without having to do any fiddling with controls. It is very realistic and I am confident that I will be able to take to the skies with a real RC without having to wreck too many of them. Great program!
Excellent RC plane simulation. Great to be able to fly and practice with models that can be purchased to physically fly.
Helps me keep some level of R/C flight skills even when I can't fly real R/C planes .. love creating my own planes , flying fields, airport objects, etc
good for brginners and experienced pilots alike.
Great for learning to fly RC airplanes and helicopters.

I recommend this to anyone and everyone that wants to learn Remote Controlled planes / helicopters. I have been using this program (before it was on steam) for over 20 years. I cannot say how much money it has saved me by crashing in the sim instead of out on the field. 

You will want / need the controller InterLinkDx sim controller at least if you do not have one already. Once you feel confident in the sim check out AMA's site and find a local club that can help you with your first flight! Good luck and remember have fun!
good graphics. flying glider over ridge line  vert responsive  zoom  get speed  then pulled up. fast flying,
Great trainer for RC aircraft.  Even seasoned pilots, I fly with, talk about the need to train, train, train.  Besides, it's a lot of fun to get a plane in the air.
I fly real RC planes and this simulator helps me prepare myself for the real world.
graphics arent great but good physics and the ability to import your own flying field is cool too

What I like most about RealFlight Evolution is that it allows me to use my controller that I will be flying my plane with. I can practice manuvers without fear of crashing my high cost plane. It also allows me to create a server to practice with my grandson who lives miles away in another state. The capability of this simulator is amazing and I highly recommend it!!
RealFlight is the perfect tool to learn how to fly RC aircraft. Our club insists that all new pilots have this program before learning at the field.
Prepares you to fly the real Radio Controlled aircraft. Lowers the likelihood of crashing for beginners.
very real.  sometimes  there is a delay between my actions and the plane reactions.  I'm using windows 11, with a fast processor.

Great software for RC plane training. Can develop skills before arriving at the flying field.
Also a great way to try out different planes when you are looking to buy one.
You CAN use flaps if you have a transmitter that supports flaps.  Don't neglect doing controller Edit and calibration to enable that.

It has made myself and my son good flyers. Without it we would of crashed long ago. My son is now flying 3d and when we flies the real planes he flies 3d without any trouble.
All the planes fly exactly like the real planes.   Amazing !!!!!!

I have gone back to the simulator again because i am doing Airplanes instead of Heli"s this time. I have logged some decent hours on the RealFlight program. I had started to fly and kept crashing.  Now I can use a whole battery pack, from take off to landing. The scenarios are endless, airfield, terrain, wind, this program has it all.
The planes fly like they do in rl. Has boosted my flying skills greatly. Great respurce if your're into flying.
good training/practising platform with realistic graphics of  the plane and surroundings
Good, fun, realistic
Awesome simulator for learning and also very fun!

Great for learning and practicing. When I was learning to fly, I practiced and learned on Realflight 4 and it really helped me out and probably saved me from crashing several real rc planes.  I bought 9.5s a few years back to get back into flying and have fun, and although I loved it, I realized not much had really changed in almost a decade. I will say the same about Evolution. I like the new planes, the graphics seem a little better, but paying $70 to upgrade from 9.5s is steep. I would think 30 or so to upgrade would be fair price, because let's be honest the software is almost still the same it always has been. I really like Realflight, and for someone who's into RC and has never had it before, full price is extremely worth it in my opinion, and I think it would be even if there were 3 planes to choose from, because that's cheaper than most models and the fact you can fly so many different types and learn the different angles and test new concepts is almost invaluable. Upgrading from 9.5s? I feel your pain, but the newer planes are really cool. Do it.
its very helpfull for begginers like I myself
Great for learning to fly RC and keeping the touch.
it helps you get better at flying before you actually fly in real life
Pretty Realistic Flight Simulator.
Great simulator. DEFINITELY improved my  skills and confidence
Does what it says on the box. You want to learn how to fly RC planes? This is where you should start.
Essential for flyers of helis especialy Wish they would add some modern helis to the mix though.
Very hard to fly with no safe on. I want to learn with no aids
its addicting and i cant get enough
its a great tool for traning to fly my carbon cub
Not only is this sim fun it will train you to fly the real things.
Very Realistic - great training aid!
great game using my Jeti DS-12
Excellent for initial flight training
The work horse of professional pilots.
best flight sim i have used.
great learning tool!
good game
love it teaching me to fly rc planes
I Like Plane.Me like To watch Planes.Me like to fly.
it is good
Really good learning tool.
fun
its fun

negative.review: Extremely Overpriced for the amount of effort the developers put in to this game, the physics engine is outdated by about 15 years, they last updated it around 2010 and it has not changed since, it was the bare minimum then. All this company does is put out new years models and charges insane amounts of money for DLC. I will jump to the next rc simulation that cares about physics. I will only recommend when the developer grows a conscience, or at the bare minimum updates the physics to be current in this decade!!! Get bent Realflight!

RealFlight is honestly a pretty good flight simulator and if you own a lot of Horizon Hobby models it is nice to be able to easily fly them in sim. _However_, I was extremely disappointed when I purchased this only to find out it is the EXACT SAME as it was years and years ago when I was a kid (with the only change being a crappy UI added on top and some new Horizon Hobby models). If the developer is not going to put the effort into updating the physics, graphics, content, etc... then there is absolutely no reason to charge such an insane amount of money. I would love to spend the money on this sim if it were updated but if that is not possible I think it's probably worth closer to $10.

Extremely Overpriced for the amount of effort the developers put in to this game, the physics engine is outdated by about 15 years, they last updated it around 2010 and it has not changed since, it was the bare minimum then. All this company does is put out new years models and charges insane amounts of money for DLC. I will jump to the next rc simulation that cares about physics. I will only recommend when the developer grows a conscience, or at the bare minimum updates the physics to be current in this decade!!! Get bent Realflight!

The flight physics haven’t improved since I originally bought G3.5 in 2006. The graphics are dated, 3D and jet physics are wooden, and the newest 700-size helicopter went out of production 5 years ago.

RealFlight is honestly a pretty good flight simulator and if you own a lot of Horizon Hobby models it is nice to be able to easily fly them in sim. _However_, I was extremely disappointed when I purchased this only to find out it is the EXACT SAME as it was years and years ago when I was a kid (with the only change being a crappy UI added on top and some new Horizon Hobby models). If the developer is not going to put the effort into updating the physics, graphics, content, etc... then there is absolutely no reason to charge such an insane amount of money. I would love to spend the money on this sim if it were updated but if that is not possible I think it's probably worth closer to $10.
$100 for the same exact sim from 15 years ago, only now with a paywall for popular models.
seriously, im tired of it NOT starting up when i try to open it.

All this company does is put out new years models and charges insane amounts of money for DLC. I will jump to the next rc simulation that cares about physics. I will only recommend when the developer grows a conscience, or at the bare minimum updates the physics to be current in this decade!!! Get bent Realflight!

The flight physics haven’t improved since I originally bought G3.5 in 2006. The graphics are dated, 3D and jet physics are wooden, and the newest 700-size helicopter went out of production 5 years ago.

RealFlight is honestly a pretty good flight simulator and if you own a lot of Horizon Hobby models it is nice to be able to easily fly them in sim. _However_, I was extremely disappointed when I purchased this only to find out it is the EXACT SAME as it was years and years ago when I was a kid (with the only change being a crappy UI added on top and some new Horizon Hobby models). If the developer is not going to put the effort into updating the physics, graphics, content, etc... then there is absolutely no reason to charge such an insane amount of money. I would love to spend the money on this sim if it were updated but if that is not possible I think it's probably worth closer to $10.
$100 for the same exact sim from 15 years ago, only now with a paywall for popular models.
